MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000421
Special Investigation Intake Date: March 3, 2025
License #: CB040201041
Licensee Group Organization: Child Family Services of NE Mich
Licensee Designee: STEPHANIE DETTLOFF
Chief Administrator: STEPHANIE DETTLOFF
Agency Name: CHILD & FAMILY SERVICES - NORTHEAST
MICHIGAN
Agency Address: 1044 US HIGHWAY 23 N
ALPENA, MI 49707-1250
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 12/20/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
5/7/2025 2:15 PM Phone Interview
3/5/2025 10:00 AM Video Conference Other
3/4/2025 8:15 AM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement.
Section • (3) The agency shall document all the following in the
Description child's record before a change of placement occurs:
• (d) Consideration of the factors identified in R
400.12404(4).
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency not assessing relatives for placement.
1

Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 03/04/2025.
Chief Administrator stated Youth A was a recent new case for this
agency. Chief Administrator stated the agency received
responsibility for Youth A 02/20/2025. Chief Administrator
reported Foster Care Worker 1 is the agency foster care worker
for Youth A.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker 1 by phone on 03/04/2025.
Foster Care Worker 1 reported she visited Youth A in Youth A's
current foster home on 03/03/2025. Foster Care Worker 1
described Youth A as having cognitive and language
limitations/barriers. The parental rights for Youth A's father were
terminated effective 08/13/2023, and the parental rights for Youth
A's mother were terminated effective 02/22/2024. Foster Care
Worker 1 stated Foster Care Worker 1 has not had any contact
with Relative since the agency received the case for Youth A. An
intent to adopt was submitted by the current foster parents in
December 2024. Youth A has expressed a desire to stay in this
foster home for adoption, so Foster Care Worker 1 has not been
active in pursuing other potential placements.
I participated in a PCU conference meeting via Teams on
03/05/2025. Other participants in the meeting were State
Worker 1, State Worker 2, Program Manager, Chief
Administrator, and Foster Care Worker 1. Foster Care Worker
1 reported that during a foster home visit with Youth A on
02/27/2025 Youth A reported little memory/relationship with
Relative or any other relative for placement consideration. Foster
Care Worker 1 described Youth A as doing well in Youth A's
current foster home and Youth A expressed a desire to stay in
Youth A's current foster home.
I interviewed Relative by phone on 05/07/2025. Relative
expressed a concern for Youth A, a possible desire for placement
of Youth A if appropriate, and an interest in future communication
with Youth A. Relative indicated she had participated in a phone
meeting on 02/13/2025 with State Worker 1, Foster Care Worker
2, Program Manager, and State Worker Supervisor. Relative
stated she felt she was used to getting additional
history/information regarding Youth A, but didn't follow up with
Relative to keep Relative informed about Youth A. Relative did
not mention adoption but did express interest in contact with
Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
2

I reviewed the case history/documents in MISACWIS for Youth A.
The documentation indicated a long history of family dysfunction
and out-of-home placements involving Youth A. The parental
rights of Youth A's father were terminated effective 08/13/2023
and Youth A's mother 02/22/2024. Youth A has a history of
multiple foster home placements. Youth A was placed in Youth
A's current foster home 10/31/2024. Youth A's current foster
parents expressed interest in adopting Youth A and signed the
Intent to Adopt paperwork 12/11/2024. Subsequent service plans
describe Youth A as doing well in this foster home/pre-adoptive
placement.
This agency received case supervision responsibility for Youth A
in 02/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with this rule. Youth A has not
had a placement change since the time the agency received case
responsibility. Youth A’s current placement is a preadoptive home
who has signed an intent to adopt. The foster care team has not
pursued any potential change in placement since receiving this
case due to the goal of adoption as the adoption team will be
responsible to make permanent placement recommendations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
05/15/2025

Mark Hunter Date
